question: 十月
sourceMnemonic: The kanji for "moon" and "month" are the same, probably because a moon cycle takes approximately a month to occur. So, what is the tenth moon cycle of the year? That would be the awesome month <vocabulary>October</vocabulary>!
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>月</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

<vocabulary>October</vocabulary> gives you <reading>jew</reading>el <reading>guts</reading> (<ja>じゅうがつ</ja>). In October, your guts magically produce jewels, which you collect to make some pretty awesome Halloween costumes.
